overview: From 2025-07-20 to 2025-07-27, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 8 new PRs (0 merged), 5 new issues, and 12 active contributors.

topIssues.title: load testing flashblocks on devnets
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
A load test should be performed on eris-0 to ensure that it's ready to be served publicly with the quality of service we're expecting from it.

During the window of this load tests:
- The normal block progression should meet 99.95% of our SLA.
- The flashblocks should meet 99% availability (availability represented by a 250ms stream of flashblocks available)

topIssues.title: enable flashblocks on prod-mainnet-op-opn-geth-f-sequencer-0
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
To progressively deploy flashblocks on mainnet, deploy it on one sequencer for the first time.

Evaluate its performance over a two-day window. Block progression should depict a 99.95% SLA over a 2-day window and flashblocks should be available 99% of the time.

topIssues.title: op-sync-tester: Support sync namespace
topIssues.author: pcw109550
topIssues.body:
- [ ] `sync_getSession`: Returns the current forkchoice view (latest, safe, finalized), session status (active, failed, completed), and any diagnostic messages. Useful for test harnesses to monitor or summarize test runs.
- [ ] `sync_deleteSession`: Deletes the session and its in-memory state. Further RPC calls using the same session UUID will return an error. Enables explicit cleanup in CI or shared environments.
- [ ] `sync_listSessions`: Lists the UUIDs of all active or recently completed sessions for a given chain ID. Accessible via the /chain/{chain_id}/synctest endpoint using a JSON-RPC call. No session UUID is required in the HTTP path for this method.

topIssues.title: Complete Geth v1.16.1 Merge
topIssues.author: mslipper
topIssues.body:
Complete the Geth v1.16.1 merge.

Open PRs:

- https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/638
- https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16785

topPRs.title: Supervisor Fuzzing
topPRs.author: gtrepta
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

This is a set of Fuzzing targets for the supervisor backend which test the cross validation across many different events and chain configurations.

**Tests**

There's a unit test for a new `EncodeEvent` utility for creating a byte array out of a `types.Message`. The fuzzing targets themselves are also new tests.

**Additional context**

The targets already should quickly find #16258 , for which we have an unmerged commit that fixes it [here](https://github.com/runtimeverification/_audits_Ethereum-optimism_pausability/commit/6b34f313462c92fc3e1fbe73c97c19efee8a6b50).

A rough breakdown of the main additions:

`chain_randomizer_test.go`:
- Utilities that create metadata for a random set of L2 chains with cross-chain messages between them.
- `RandomChainParams` struct for configuring the chain metadata
- `RandomChain` struct generated from `RandomChainParams`
- Utilities to invalidate a `RandomChain` (`InsertCycle`, `InsertFutureDependency`, ...)

`cross_update_fuzz_test.go`:
A file with all of the fuzzing targets, functions to setup the backend with a `RandomChain`, and predicate functions to assert invariants.

topPRs.title: feat(op-acceptance-tests): add more sysgo tests.
topPRs.author: scharissis
topPRs.body: Adds a lot more sysgo tests (all of them)! This is as part of the effort to unify all acceptance tests into the one workflow in CI.

topPRs.title: Remove proxyAdmin input from the OpChainConfig struct
topPRs.author: AmadiMichael

topPRs.title: op-batcher: The exposed method NextFrame can't be used outside the current package
topPRs.author: mask-pp
topPRs.body: The exposed method NextFrame can't be used outside the current package.

topContributors.summary: Wazabie: This week, Wazabie focused on a significant upgrade within the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` repository. They merged a substantial PR (#1144) to update templates and example tasks, which involved a major refactor of +3914/-4598 lines. This work modified 18 files, with a notable portion of the changes impacting tests.

scharissis: Focused on improving test coverage in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a pull request to add more sysgo tests for `op-acceptance-tests` (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16817).

AmadiMichael: Focused on configuration refactoring within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They proposed a simplification to the `OpChainConfig` struct by opening a pull request (#16798) to remove the `proxyAdmin` input. This work consisted of changes across 12 files, with a primary focus on configuration and test files.

rickck11: This week, rickck11 contributed a documentation fix to the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository. They merged PR #16753, which corrected line continuation with backslashes. This activity indicates a focus on improving documentation.

gtrepta: Focused on improving system robustness by introducing supervisor fuzzing to the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a significant pull request (#16791) which added over 1800 lines of new code. This work was concentrated on adding new tests and the corresponding code to enable this new testing capability.
Ethnical: Contributed to code quality and collaboration this week by reviewing and commenting on 4 pull requests.
blmalone: Focused on bug fixes this week, committing changes across 10 files (+142/-107 lines). They also contributed to ongoing work by providing feedback on 3 pull requests.

maximevtush: Focused on improving test clarity in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They opened two pull requests to enhance code readability by renaming a test harness (#16782) and a test contract (#16781). This work involved minor refactoring exclusively within test files.

mask-pp: This week, mask-pp's work was focused on the `op-batcher` in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a pull request (#16830) to address an issue with an exposed method. This contribution consisted of a single commit with minor modifications to both code and test files.

mslipper: Focused on planning and coordination within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They created two key issues to track major initiatives: one for the Geth v1.16.1 merge (#16825) and another for the "Min Base Fee" feature (#16807).

yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on the flashblocks feature in the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository, creating issues to plan for load testing on devnets (#16756) and to enable it on a production sequencer (#16759).

pcw109550: This week, their focus was on the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, where they identified a potential enhancement for the `op-sync-tester`. They opened issue #16778 to propose adding support for the sync namespace.
